Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: ROBHCheltenham
Reviews.Content: Dont know where to start, great location and hotel all round. Really helpful staff who could not do enough for us. Breakfast was as good as we have had on our travels. Easy reach of the airport and about 30 mins transfer time. You can take the S Bahn directly from the airport getting off at Warschauer StraBe. The station to be honest is awful but only 10 ins from the train. Do not be put off by this small area around it, its a short walk. The hotel rooms were spacious with sofa and chairs, also TV and mini bar. The shower is again 10/10 as is the room and the rest of this hotel. Take in the many sights of Berlin and one part of the wall is a short walk back down past the station. As well as the usual tours DO NOT FORGET to take the U-Bahn to Gesundbrunner station where the Berlin Unterwelten is situated, it is a 90 minute under ground tour of a Berlin bunker. We took the English tour guided by "Sean", it was informative and very funny but this gives you a close look at one of Berlin's air raid shelter. Back to the hotel, all eight of us gave this 10/10. We could not have picked better and would book again should we visit this very different city. It is still very much East and West.

Reviews.Title: “Upstalsboom Hotel Review”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a 5 minute walk from a very central subway stop. It is very clean and the service is absolutely excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: Rosolino
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights and would highly recommend it. Booking through an internet site, we got a great price and the big added plus was that it was free for our 13- year old son too. We choose a comfort room to give us some extra space, as there were the three of us. Breakfast was outstanding and far superior to other four star hotels that we've stayed in around the world. The reception desk staff were very friendly, but not all spoke English well. It's located in a quiet street about 5 - 7 minutes walk from a train station Warschauer. It's not right in the centre of Berlin, but that can be reached with a 10-minute S- Bahn train journey and you have the great bonus of getting a lot more for your money.

Reviews.Title: “A Gem of a Hotel”
Reviews.Author: CheshireHolidaymaker
Reviews.Content: Stayed here over New Year 2011/12 and as other reviewers have stated ,what a gem of a hotel. It is in a quiet area of Berlin 5 minutes from a U or S Bahn station which has routes to all places of interest and to the charter airport Schonerfeld,The hotel has excellent staff always curteous,cheerful and helpful, the breakfast provided is of the highest order and certainly one of the best i have encountered on my travels.There are restaurants and supermarkets nearby' I would certainly stay here if i return to Berlin,Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value, pleasant hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: BostonTraveler62
Reviews.Content: Well located on a quiet street in Friedrichshain, easy walk to S-Bahn, U-Bahn and Tram on Warschauer St. Neighborhood has a lot to offer in the way of shops, restaurants, cafes. Felt very safe. Pleasant small hotel, rooms basic but comfortable. Minibar and safe in the room. Staff all spoke good English and were competent and genuinely helpful. Breakfast buffet was outstanding! Restaurant was also quite okay with decent prices. Room service available. Small sauna open 6 to 10 PM, free. There is a computer and free internet in the lobby. Got a very good room rate through internet sites, better than offered on the hotel's own website which are about double. This hotel is quite popular and books fast, especially on weekends.

Reviews.Title: “Pricey hotel but for a good reason”
Reviews.Author: faruz
Reviews.Content: Not the cheapest hotel you can find in Berlin, but you get a real classy hotel located in a great area just next to Warschauer Strasse station. Its also located a walking distance from Revaler Strasse, a street filled with pubs and restaurants open all night long. Rooms are big and fancy, breakfast is absolutely awesome and the hotel staff is very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “A really nice 4* Hotel in a wonderful location!”
Reviews.Author: Jeni-96
Reviews.Content: If you wish to visit former East Germany, too - this is the best place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “good hotel”
Reviews.Author: abhigopal
Reviews.Content: Close to the S bahn station and walking distance from a lot of good pubs, and east end gallery. Not too far from Alexanderplatz. the breakfast was very good, free internet in the lobby area. We used this for a few meetings and the conference facilities were good as well. Car parking is also available.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: hanalala
Reviews.Content: A quiet, clean, contemporary hotel. Good breakfast. Great neighbourhood. Good value.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value hotel for a Berlin citybreak”
Reviews.Author: CallumLondon
Reviews.Content: There's not a lot I can add to what other reviewers have said about the Upstalsboom Berlin. It's typical of a 4 star German hotel - clean, compact, efficient and serves an excellent buffet breakfast. The location is very good, although it's a 5-10 minute walk to the nearest trains and trams, so you might not want to take pubic transport to/from the airport unless you don't have much luggage to carry. A taxi from Tegel Airport cost €29. As well as easy access to central Berlin on the S Bahn, there's plenty of cafes, bars and restaurants a short walk away on Simon-Dach-Strasse, as well as the East Side Gallery (a part of the Berlin Wall which is now an open air art gallery). Supermarkets are conveniently located on Rüdersdorfer Strasse (for Aldi) or Gubener Strasse (for Kaiser). There's also numerous kebab shops in the area if you want a quick, cheap snack. I found Antalya (corner of Kopernikusstrasse and Warschauer Strasse) to be the best tasting. The hotel staff were helpful, very familiar with the area and happy to answer all my tourist questions. The hotel bar wasn't great, as it was lacking in atmosphere and overpriced for drinks (€4.50 for a large beer), but being Berlin, there are plenty of alternatives. As others have said, no free in room wi-fi is a shame, and so is the lack of air conditioning, but I'm sure it's not a major problem apart from the hottest months. There were also some reviewers who commented on the beggars not far from the hotel on the walk to the train station. Simply do as the locals do and ignore them. They don't do any harm.

Reviews.Title: “Berlin is such a fantastic city and this hotel adds to the trip”
Reviews.Author: Jasminestorm
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this 4* hotel in one of its family rooms and it did not let us down! The room was huge and still had plenty of room for a "living room area". The breakfasts are fab, with as much choice as one could wish for. They even had Earl Grey Tea! The only bad thing about this hotel is no air conditioning - and boy is it needed! (Berlin was very hot when we were there). I would stay here again! My top tips to see Berlin: 1)Get the Welcome card (It is available at the airport tourist information) and it will cover all your trains (including the one from the airport into Berlin). It also allows up to 3 children (under 15) to travel with you. It gives great discounts on various things to see and do so it really is worth the inital investment. 2) Go up the TV tower. You can see all of Berlin from there (and get a discount if you have the welcome card) and they do the most fab cocktails! 3) If you want to go to the Reichstag - book online in advance. It is free entry but too busy to just drop by (We learnt this the hard way!) 4) Research where you want to visit in advance - and include resteurants in that research. We found ourselves walking for an hour to find a decent place to eat! 5) Visit the Wall and Potsdamer Platz. It gives you a chance to really see the changes that have taken place over the last 22 years. 6) Go on a boat cruise. It is a beautiful way to see the city. (Be warned of very expensive water on board!)

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel and handy for everything”
Reviews.Author: Eric51
Reviews.Content: Just back from 3 nights at the Upstalsboom Hotel Friedrichshain. Situated in the east of the city within walking distance of the S-Bahn & U-Bahn stations of Warschauer Str, with good links to most of the places of interest in the city. Nearby are the cafes, bars and restaurants of Simon-Dach-Str and a little further afield is the East Side Gallery with its ‘beach bars’ situated between the wall and the river. The rooms were more than adequate for our stay although lacked any drawer space. It was very hot and the hotel does not have aircon. Consequently, we needed to leave the windows open at night and as the road outside is cobbled, even the lightest of vehicles sounded like a tank coming down the road. However, this did not spoil our stay and you can always ask for a room at the back of the hotel which I’m sure wouldn’t suffer the same problem. As has been mentioned before the breakfasts are excellent with plenty of choice to set you up for the rest of the day. The hotel has its own bar which we didn’t use, choosing instead to have a drink at the Hirsch bar just over the road.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: teacherakos
Reviews.Content: Pros: - Nice and quiet location - Close to: * S Bahn, 500m away from Warschauer stasse station * Tram, line M10 * City Center (Mitte), two metro stations away from Alexanderplatz * Simon-Dach Strasse, with a lot restaurants cafes etc - Great breakfast - Clean rooms - Polite Staff Cons: - No WiFi in the room, only in the lobby area

Reviews.Title: “We could not do better choice”
Reviews.Author: Christina06
Reviews.Content: We ' ve been to this hotel from 17th to 23rd of April. It was great value for money. It was close to train stations and u-bahn. The hotel itself had all the necessary equipment and the room was more than decent. It was spacious enough nad clean. They gave us several "gifts" (bottle of mineral water, washing caps. something for cleaning shoes e.t.c.). The room was heated water all day in the shower and also ,although the weather was veeeeery good the room was also warm ,without using any source of heating, proof of having built with fine structural elements. The breakfast buffet was excellent. The staff was speaking good english and they were helpfull. Also, close to the hotel there are several different pubs and restaurants with any kind of cuisine (japanese, chinese, mexican, indian, tapas e.t.c.) Try them as there provided good food and low prices. The only thing that i can think as a negative is that the Wi-fi area was limited in the reception area , but i believe it is not worth mentioning. This hotel will definitely be my choice if i visit Berlin again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location in the heart of Berlins cafe district”
Reviews.Author: SeanC67
Reviews.Content: Better than average hotel right in the middle of Friedrichshain where you can walk down Kopernikusstrasse and take your pick of cuisines from around the world or just settle into a local bier cafe and sample local pils to your hearts content. Close also to tram and train, and Alexanderplatz about an hours walk if your feeling particularly energetic. Breakfasts up to the typical German standard.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a city break”
Reviews.Author: Lisgya
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights. Good location, close to S Bahn, tram line and buses. 10 min walk to the East side gallery. Plenty of good restaurants/bars/cafes nearby, and if you wish some cool clubs too. Room clean and comfortable and quiet, excellent breakfast, staff polite. WiFi in reception area only. Fair price.

Reviews.Title: “Ticked all the boxes”
Reviews.Author: Forest1963
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel when visiting Berlin for a couple of days sightseeing. Friendly staff, great rooms and a super breakfast made our stay very comfortable. The hotel is situated in the Eastern side of the City but dont let that put you off - its within walking distance of trains, buses and everything you need to get into and around town. All at a great price too.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean, quiet, comfortable and good value - would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: ispy7
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel for a 4-day sightseeing trip based on reviews on TripAdvisor, and we weren't disappointed! We were very happy with the high standard of cleanliness, pleasant decor and lovely breakfasts (I know everyone says it, but they really do set you up for the day!) and we were able to watch Columbo in German on the TV with a very reasonably-priced local beer from the minibar when we felt like it. The hotel was within walking distance of a cool flea market and a cheap and delicious vegan/veggie (& meat) cafe called Hot Dog & Soup, and just down the road from a gorgeous-looking pub that we never quite made it along to - next time! Everything else we wanted to visit (Reichstag, TV tower, Schlossgarten etc.) was just a short Ubahn ride away and we found the public transport system very efficient and easy to use. Which reminds me - to get there from Tegel airport, if you don't want to shell out for a taxi, you just need to buy a ticket for zones 1&2 from the yellow machines by the airport bus stops, get the X9 to Zoo (Zoologischer Garten), and a Ubahn to Warschauer Strasse or Frankfurter Tor. By the way, if you're veggie, there are plenty of places serving excellent falafel around Berlin, so don't worry about it all being sausage and sauerkraut! If you want to treat yourself, I'd also recommend Cookies Cream for more imaginative veggie cuisine and they work very hard to make you grateful you were permitted to experience it! (see restuarant reviews) Back to the hotel - the 'gym' was very small, and we didn't get a chance to try the sauna as we were never around between 6.30 and 10pm when it was open, but we had a look at the roof terrace, and tried out a solar room thing that was quite fun. So, altogether it was perfect for our needs - if there was anything to moan about, and there isn't really, it was a shame that wifi was only free in the lobby area, which meant that we had to spend time uploading our photos in the functional, but rather soulless, entrance area rather than in the comfort of our room.

Reviews.Title: “OK IF YOU REALLY NEED THIS NEIGHBORHOOD, BUT OTHERWISE I WOULD LOOK ELSEWHERE”
Reviews.Author: StealthySteven
Reviews.Content: Booked two nights at $120 per night. As quality hotels in Berlin are often less expensive than in other large cities, I expected more from the Upstalsboom. First of all, everything seems very clean and in good condition so I have no complaints about that. I had a corner room with a panoramic view and the room was fairly large, but laid out poorly. The very small flat panel TV was about the size of a computer monitor, and the only English channels were BBC news and MTV. Good blackout drapes certainly help for those who like to sleep late. I liked that there was a second closeable door leading into the bedroom which kept out almost any noise that might have come from the hallway. But the bathroom was extremely small with only one tiny halogen light in the ceiling which really didn’t light up the room enough. No light anywhere near the mirror made it difficult see while shaving. Small stand alone wash basin with only an extremely small glass shelf above which could barely hold essential toiletries. Shower (no bathtub) in the corner was just part of the normal floor of the bathroom separated only by a shower curtain. When you use the wash basin, you are partially standing on the shower floor. Combination soap/shampoo was dispensed from squeeze bottles attached to the wall in the shower area and next to the wash basin. No separate bar soap or small shampoo bottles provided. I forgot to bring toothpaste and the reception provided me a kit containing a small toothbrush and toothpaste free of charge so I appreciated that. Furnishings were functional, but certainly did not give a feeling of luxury. The one telephone was on a desk completely across the room from the bed. So if you want to make or receive phone calls while in bed, it isn’t possible. No clock in the room…. Good thing I always bring my own small one with me. Wifi is available free in the lobby, but costs a whopping 8 Euro PER HOUR if you want to access the internet from your room. Parking: 14 Euro per day. Room service menu extremely limited. No complaints about the front desk staff. They were extremely helpful with requests. The hotel is in a very quiet area of mostly apartment buildings and offices and I could not find a lot of good dining choices in the immediate area. If you really want to be in this neighborhood for some particular reason, the Upstalsboom might be ok, but after all is said and done I think one could find a better hotel in a better location within Berlin at a similar or cheaper price.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value, Okay Location, Great Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: TravellingLou
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for four nights in September 2010. It is about 10 minute walk from the S Bahn Station and there are lots of bars and restaurants nearby, but the street on which the hotel is on is nice and quiet. The rooms are a reasonable size and very clean and tidy. The breakfast was extensive and very tasty. I would recommend staying at this hotel for a weekend break.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value.”
Reviews.Author: kharden
Reviews.Content: Very comfortable, good breakfast, secure garage parking friendly staff and excellent value for money. I would certainly return.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent and attentive service”
Reviews.Author: indogerman
Reviews.Content: The staff were friendly and attentive The room was clean and there is also a bike rental service. The location is convenient for public transportation. I'd go back anytime

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Big Rooms and lovely Food”
Reviews.Author: shaz893
Reviews.Content: I chose to stay with Upstalsboom as it was advertised as a four star hotel and had reasonable reviews. We decided to try and catch the train to get to the hotel but i would not recommend this as we got lost. Also the train station is a 10minute walk from the hotel so if you do not know where u are going you could just be wondering. The service is good all staff speak English, the rooms are big and the bathrooms are a good size, my only critiisim is the lack of air conditioning. The room got very hot in the night. The food was lovely and there was so much variety. A good selection of hot and cold food is available and they try to cater to everyone. The remains of the Berlin Wall is a 15 minute walk from the hotel and the train station is near. It is a good base to see Berlin A good hotel

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, great staff, good location, wonderful breakfast”
Reviews.Author: kns9499
Reviews.Content: We (2 adults and 1 child) stayed at this hotel from 23-28 July, 2010. The staff were all friendly, knowledgeable and helpful. The room was beautiful - clean, spacious, well laid out. We especially liked the bathroom. We were on the 6th floor with a great view of the street. We enjoyed the sounds of people walking and talking. The breakfast was included in the price. It was incredible - pastries, breads, yogurts, canned & fresh fruit, cereals, eggs, cheeses, meats, coffee, tea, juice and milk. You can't ask for more. The hotel was walking distance to the train which enabled easy travel within Berlin. The hotel sells transport passes which is a bonus! We would highly recommend this hotel in Berlin. Note Internet is complementary only in the lobby, but must pay for it in the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in quiet location but close to lots”
Reviews.Author: muchachitaoz
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel. The staff were friendly, helpful, spoke good English & as a firsy, had the spare bed ready & made up in the room. The room was very spacious with planty of room to sleep for the 3 of us as well as a sofa & chair to relax on or watch TV. On the 2nd floor we got the internet wireless working (for free- should have cost us) but there is free internet in the foyer. Breakfast was a feast, lots of choice & delicious & fresh. No facilities for making tea/ coffee in the room but they had a big bowl of apples for guests to help themselves at reception. Friedrichshain is a fun area, lots of places to eat & drink & a short walk to U & S Bahn stations as well as the tram. It was good to stay in a local neighbourhood, away from the tourist crowds.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with nice service”
Reviews.Author: antto77
Reviews.Content: Good standard in rooms, with all you need. Not luxurious but very clean and not ragged at all. The breakfast buffee was very nice with a lot of choises. The restaurant at the hotel was nicely priced and there is also a standard lobby bar where we enjoyed some beers. Very nice staff, helpful and kind. The location is good, near Warschauer Strasse where you reach the S-bahn, metro and buses. The internet conenction plans were highly overpriced, and there were only choises of one day (8€) and one month (30€). What to do when you are staying four nights?

Reviews.Title: “Well located clean,comfortable Hotel in Berlin....”
Reviews.Author: GalwayRed
Reviews.Content: I was part of a large group that stayed in this Hotel for a weekend in November. Service was good through out the weekend. No problems checking in - we were even slightly early but the rooms were ready regardless.Rooms were clean,simple and comfortable,nice bathroom - again we didn't spend a huge amount of time in the rooms but they were perfect for our weekend.Breakfast was buffet style with plenty of fresh fruit,cheeses,ham,bread etc which was a good start to the day and was served until 11. Location was good.Just off one of the main street's in the area so close access to S Bahn and trams. The area itself is probably less developed than other parts of Berlin and has quite a bit of street art and alternative shops,bar and markets but I think this added to our weekend.

Reviews.Title: “A no brainer hotel - clean, simple & effective - Recommended . . .”
Reviews.Author: Crash_Rescue
Reviews.Content: This hotel is clean, simple and effective. The location is not exactly city centre roll out the door into the "Unter den Linden" but then it doesn’t pretend to be this either. 25 minutes from Schonefeld Airport with the efficient S-Bahn and a brief 5 minute walk puts you in the reception of this four star hotel. Back to the station and a 8 minute ride on the S-Bahn puts you in Alexanderplatz or 25 minutes later in Potsdamerplatz. This hotel is a great base from which to see the city full stop. The building is modern and the styling is fresh but not arty by design. The rooms are on the small side accompanied by small bathrooms but the space is large enough for you to crash at the end of a long day's sight seeing. One small note -the very comfortable king size beds are pushed up against the wall meaning that you have to climb over your partner or slide down to the end of the bed to get out for that visit to the bathroom. You could do what I did and wait for your partner to get up first giving you that extra 10 minutes that you deserve in a warm bed. Another quick point - expect two single bed covers and a single square shaped pillow - very traditional and can be romantic if you want to share otherwise no need to fight for who gets the quilt. House keeping have lots of extras if you need them. The bathrooms are modern with endless amounts of hot water and all the space that you need but again be warned its a walk in shower only unless specified. The hotel provides quality soaps and creams etc and house keeping does a good job of cleaning everything and providing fresh towels etc when requested. The room includes a small table and arm chair, a telephone, a small flat screen TV with about 25 programmes free of charge (mainly in German but there was BBC World News and a few music channels to occupy you if needed). A sky package in English at 12 Euros per day gives a few move sky channels including films and adult entertainment but I already pay sky enough at home for this and the thought of paying them again at these rates sends me spare! Wifi is present and free of charge thorughout the building. A standard mini bar provides you with all the usual temptations but surprisingly (or not given where this hotel chain comes from) Jever beer in the fridge compared to the standard Berliner beer. Prices are at the higher end of reasonable. Location wise the hotel stands in a residential area covered with graffiti, which in Berlin is a very good thing. At first glance you may find this off putting but look deeper and you'll see some excellent shops and services sit behind what would otherwise be a dull concrete wall. As stated earlier the hotel is readily accessed by S-Bahn at Warshauer Stasse. It's also very close to the continuous 1.3km length of original Berlin Wall still standing in the city. Ironically during my visit this month parts of this wall were being demolished and rebuilt presumably for health and safety reasons after so many holes were made in it. I was lucky to speak with one of the original artists who was busy repainting his original artwork from a photo taken in 1989 on the newly repaired wall. This section of wall is well worth a visit. The hotel provides a good quality breakfast in an all you can eat affair from very early in the morning to 10:30 am weekdays and 11 am weekends & public holidays. I didn’t use the hotel restaurant or bar / lounge area so can’t give me verdicts for these two areas. My main reason for this is because there’s a fantastic bar on the door step (out the hotel door turn left and across the road) call “Hirsch”, the German word for Deer. At Hirsch you can eat and drink is authentic southern German style. The food menu is small but offers fantastic quality and very reasonable prices. The cocktails are good and the bottle beer choice stretches to some 29 different bands in various strengths and sizes. To sample the entire bottle beer choice would equate to about 8 litres of beer for approximately 40 Euros. The staff are a friendly and helpful sort with good English and other language skills. The Hirsch bar comes highly recommended. Other local eat include a fantastic – high quality – kebab shop on the Warshauer strasse which you pass to get to the S-Bahn. The shop is called “Saray” and they provide great home made meals for very little money. They have a good selection of food and speak a blend of English, Turkish and German. The eatery is very popular with locals and again is highly recommended. If you won’t try it you’ll never know just how good a meal it was that you missed. All in the hotel is easily recommended. Go ahead and make you booking worry free. It’s a no brainer.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, lovely room”
Reviews.Author: Vokon
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights to explore Berlin. Reception staff were welcoming and friendly, also helpful. The room was spacious and recently refurbished with small sitting area with sofa and armchair. Beds were quite hard (normal in Germany) and only one very soft pillow, but extra pillows were provided when we asked. Shower room was spacious and well equipped - the shower was great - worked very well. Breakfast was an excellent buffet affair with very good choice which did vary a bit each day and was constantly topped up. As we were quite tired each evening we ate in the restaurant which offered good value menu with very good service. The staff generally spoke good English, but a little German went a long way and seemed to be appreciated by them. The only downside is that there is a lot of graffitti in the area - it is in former East Berlin, and the are is a bit run down so there are not a lot of good restaurants nearby (hence eating at the hotel). It is about 8 min walk to S & U Bahn station then only a few stops to Alexanderplatz station. Ostbahnhof (main line) is about 15 mins walk. The hotel is excellent value for money and if it was more central would be a lot more expensive. I'd certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Overnight”
Reviews.Author: Alswanders
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night with my family before returning home from Berlin. The hotel is smart, clean and reasonable value. It is reasonably placed for public transport about a 7/8 minute walk to the train station. only real downside was the are was a bit uncomfortable with much graffitti aound the station area and a few tramp types around. However, we had no problems and it isn't that bad by city standards. Good breakfast and also a good, reasonably priced restaurant actually within the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice value for money”
Reviews.Author: Frank_Hasselt
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel via a booking site and decided to stay based on the very good price for a 4 star hotel and because of the location. I wanted to stay in the Friedrichhain area. The hotel is worth its 4 stars. Its very clean (I wouldnt expect anything else from a German hotel btw) with nice service. The rooms were good value for money. Bathrooms were very clean. The only negative for me was the plastic cover on the bed, which bothered me and the fact that there was no airco in the room. Since I stayed there on 3 very hot july nights; it could get very warm in the room. The breakfast was fantastic ; Like I remembered it from my childhood when I was taking holidays with my parents and when we stayed in guestrooms in Germany. Very good indeed. About the location; the U-Bahn and S-Bahn stations were close by; so visiting Berlin from this location is very easy ; the hotel is located in the neigborhood of the Simon Dach Strasse; which is a very nice street if you want to enjoy dinning and drinking nightlife in Berlin with very reasonable prices. The service in the hotel was professional, nice and friendly ; the english was great. The negative was the fact that there was no internet in the room. THe internet in the lobby (and restaurant) was free and fast. I will definitely stay in this hotel again when I come back to Berlin next time.

Reviews.Title: “A brilliant base for exploring Berlin”
Reviews.Author: BevarChristiania
Reviews.Content: Managed to get an online deal for this 4-star hotel, which would normally be out of my league. Totally loved it. Had a quiet room that faced an inner courtyard. Good-sized wardrobe with safe. Huge bed. Recently renovated, largeish shower/bathroom with huge mirror and decent lighting. The breakfast buffet is a real hit -- massive choice, both sweet and savoury. Everything very fresh. I particularly liked the varieties of smoked and pickled fish on offer, alongside the cheeses, meats, jams, cereals, juices. Lots of different types of bread, rounded off by cakes. Breakfast ran until 10.30am (11am at the weekends -- very civilised). Basically, if you fill up in the morning, you won't need lunch. Excellent breakfast service -- trays refilled v quickly and attentive staff. They also do room service of sorts: you order something from a menu, they make it for you and then you take the tray up to your room. Wasn't too sure about that though and felt that room service should mean room service. The roof terrace is another wonderful feature, esp. in the summer. They often do barbecue buffets up there, and you can eat while watching the sun go down over the rooftops. The hotel has a nice restaurant too, and a bar, but I also liked the little cafe round the corner (great mojitos!), the fondue restaurant on the corner and the pancakes in the cozy kneipe across the road. The location is quiet -- you can't hear Warschauer Strasse round the corner, but the hotel is very close to the happening restaurant district Simon-Dach-Strasse. Friedrichshain is fast taking over from Prenzlberg and Kreuzberg as Berlin's food and fashion hotspot. Wuehlishstrasse, with its many fashion boutiques, is not far on foot. Restaurant-wise, Simon-Dach-Strasse is excellent value for money. Another reviewer felt the area looked tatty -- but this is Berlin's East so not everything will have been renovated yet. Because rents are (still) relatively cheap, artists and designers can afford to live, create and sell here. And some Gruenderzeit facades are absolutely fascinating as is the Zuckerbaecker style in nearby Karl-Marx-Strasse. To get into the centre of Berlin, the S-Bahn is maybe 5-10 mins away on foot. Expect joyous crowds there drinking from beer bottles and moving on to the next club at 2am in the morning -- to zero aggro. That's how it should be. A tip: Volkspark Friedrichshain offers open-air cinema in the summer. Pick an English-language film (look for "OmU" -- original version with subtitles), pay 6 Euros, buy a bottle of beer and a sausage and enjoy the show.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: giddalause
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel with our baby girl who is 9 months old. The hotel provided everything we needed for her, like bed, dipars, food, changing unit, bibs, etc. for free! They even gave us a room with a small kitchen with microwave and steriliser without us having to pay extra. What a fantastic hotel! Also the room it self and breakfast was great

Reviews.Title: “Great value - Recommended!”
Reviews.Author: Currywurst1
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a short trip to Berlin. We found the Upstalsboom Hotel fantastic value. It is not cool or anything but an excellent, well equipped mid-price hotel in a convenient location (i.e. close to rail connections and within easy walking distance of shops/bars etc in Friedrichshain). It is the extras that make this hotel a great choce. For example, they offer free bike hire (which we took advantage of and it saved us at least 20 euros a day between the two of us). The breakfast is also ample. The staff are also really helpful (for example lending us an umbrella for a couple of days). We would stay there again without any hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in an a trendy area.”
Reviews.Author: fairone2000
Reviews.Content: My partner and I arrived into Tegel airport with zero knowledge of Berlin. The airport rep advised bus into Zoo and then train to Wauscher Strause. We then walked for about 6 minutes to the hotel. I have to admit that my first impressions of the area were not all that good with the litter and graffiti everywhere but pleasantly surprised on arrival at the hotel. A young blonde girl attended to us and she seemed quite flippant and away with the fairies (to be polite). The lovely long dark, cury haired girl was however really friendly and helpful.The room was clean and attended to everday so never worried about the cleanliness which I am a stickler for. The rooms do get stuffy and the windows do open however if does get a tad noisey in the courtyard. Breakfast was truly fabulous and really set the standard for the rest of the trip where no other European hotel or 5 star Dubai hotel even came close. You come to realise that the graffiti is part of the trendy area and we felt safe walking to and fro the great streets full of restaurants and bars only blocks away. I would recommend the Upstalsboom and would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Worked well for us”
Reviews.Author: mack09
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel was good for exploring Friedrichshain. There are a ton of stores and restaurants/bars all within 15 min walking distance. The East Side Gallery and the Spree are about 10 min away. It is close to public transportation- the stop at Warschauer Str has both a subway and an S-bahn stop. It is only a few stops to Alex or the Hackescher Markt and only a few more to Mitte. I booked two standard rooms and they were fine for our purposes. My husband and I ended up with a terrific corner room with 4 windows. We could even see the TV tower from our room. Even though it was a standard double, we had a kitchenette and a couch/living area. My sister had a room down the hall and it was pretty standard-nothing special. Breakfast was included in the price and it was a nice buffet with a large selection. Pretty good value. There is also a terrace on the roof, but no bar up there. I guess you can bring up your own drinks... There were two snotty blonde girls there at check in, who I didn't like, but the rest of the staff was much nicer. Important for Americans! This hotel has no A/C!!! I would therefore, not recommend it in the warmer months. Even though it wasn't super warm when we were there, once the drapes were shut, there was no air moving in the room and it got quite stuffy. I am sure in the winter it is great, but I wouldn't want to be there in August. I booked online though Expedia and paid in advance, so check in and check out were very easy. There is a paid parking garage available, but there is plenty of on the street parking nearby, so park on the street and save yourself 13 euro a night.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel But Not a 4*”
Reviews.Author: Lancsman1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in early February. We booked a room for 3 and were given a corner room with a sofa bed. As it was a corner room, the layout was a little eccentric and with the sofa bed extended. there was very little room to move about. However, the room was comfortable and we slept well. The breakfast was reasonable with a good choice of items. All the staff, who we came into contact with, were friendly and helpful. Don't be put off by the area. When arriving at Warschauerstrasse station, you get the feeling that the area is very run down. However, once you get away from the station, the area is fine-always busy, both day and night and we always felt safe. Overall, the hotel is good value for money and only 5 minutes walk from the station which has good links into Berlin. However, it is some way from the main sights and you can feel just a bit out of it.

Reviews.Title: “Great time at Upstalsboom”
Reviews.Author: Marploug
Reviews.Content: My husband and 2 sons booked into the Upstalsboom Hotel at the end of August 08. On check in we were given an upgrade which was great to a room which had self catering facilities if we wanted them. Our sons had a twin room - both our rooms were immaculate. The staff were exceptionally helpful. The hotel was spotless. The selection at breakfast was really good and the food was great value. The hotel was really handy for the S bahn which we used all the time. We bought a 72 hour ticket from the hotel reception which was handy. The nearest S Bahn was Warschauer Strasse which is on the main line from the airport and goes to places like Alexanderplatz and Hackesher Marke. Definately recommend this one. Lovely hotel, good food and real handy for all the sights.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: IvanDobsky
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights and it couldn't have been better. The hotel is very clean, staff are polite and friendly and the rooms are comfortable. The area is very young and dynamic. A few mins walk away is Simon-Dach-Straße with loads of great bars/restaurants. The S-Bahn is 10 mins walk from the hotel. Highly Recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Good if you can see past the area”
Reviews.Author: Jabei
Reviews.Content: As other reviewers have stated, the one drawback is the initial view of the area the hotel is in. First - the positives.... It's quite reasonable if you are in a couple...not so much if you are on your own The Breakfast is good - not brilliant but certainly good enough an above average. The rooms are large. The bathrooms are clean and modern. The staff are friendly The terrace garden is nice. Nightlife in the area is very good indeed. Resonably priced and good quality for the average traveller. very studenty but at the same time very atmospheric. Warschauer StrasseStation is 5 mins away and trains to the centre of Berlin are frequent and take about 15 mins. BUT The station, by anyone's standard is ROUGH.... Many homeless hanging around the entrance and a lot of dodgy looking people around BUT We never felt threatened...there was never any sense of impending doom and although there was a lot of drinking on the street around the station, there was never any feeling that there would be trouble. If you are prepared for the poor look of the area, this is definitely a good place to stay. You'll have a great time along the various roads near to the hotel. We found there was no need to go into Berlin for the evenings as all you could need with regard to Bars and restaurants was in the immediate vicinity of the hotel. One more thing - the lack of Air Con could make it pretty uncomfortable in Summer

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable And Convenient”
Reviews.Author: DSandPM
Reviews.Content: You won't be excited by the location of this hotel - but you certainly will have an enjoyable, comfortable and relaxing stay. It's a residential area and lacks the style and up-market image of central Berlin but the hotel is only a short walk from a couple of U-bahn stations so it's easy to get anywhere across the city. It's clean and modern and the buffet breakfast is terrific. There is one problem, however. The rooms are not air-conditioned and when the temperature in Berlin touches the high 20s and 30 degrees C, it can become uncomfortable - especially at night. For a business stay or a weekend break you get excellent value for money. Several of the local bars and restaurants have plenty of atmosphere and serve food and drink at reasonable prices. Wander up to Karl-Marx Allee to see some amazing left-over Communist architecture and sample the food in the quiet restaurants of the area. Berlin is 'must-visit' city...and you won't be disappointed by staying at the Hotel Friedrichshain.

Reviews.Title: “Can recommend Upstalsboom Hotel, Berlin”
Reviews.Author: MsScott4
Reviews.Content: This hotel is well located for getting to all the interesting areas of Berlin. An easy five minute walk to the S-Bahn. The hotel was easy to find, quick and efficient reception service. The room was large and very clean. Breakfast was brilliant. The whole hotel impressed me. At first glance the area seemed a little doubtful but it was absolutely fine to walk around late evening and we felt very safe. There are some nice pubs and restaurants close by so all in all we really felt this was a good choice and we would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “awesome hotel”
Reviews.Author: brainless69
Reviews.Content: Decided on the upstalboom after reading a few reviews and them being the only hotel with a triple room. We got to the upstalboom just before midnight to be greeted by a smiley receptionist very quick and easy check in. The room was Big with two single beds and one fold out sofa bed. The bathroom was basic with toilet and shower(no bath) and a washing basin. Our highlight was the fridge it was HUGE and we could fit all our alcohol in it. Breakfast-Really good, good choice of cold cuts/cheeses, Cereals different types of breads. Hot foods sausages/eggs/hashbrowns. Lots of different choices of teas and juices. Fresh cakes-i recommend the cheesecake if you are so lucky to get some. We didnt it went really quickly and they didnt bring out anymore. There is a gym and sauna room which i didnt use but had a look at. very basic gym and small sauna room. Internet terminal we read was free didnt manage to use it as they had a private function in the room you need to go through to get to the terminal. It also has a printer too. Unfortunatly the thing we were looking forward to most is the roof terrace bar but it was closed due to cold weather and snow. Otherwise everything in hotel was good and for the price you couldnt ask for a better hotel in a great location.We found it easier to get the the hotel from Warschaser Strabe (5-10mins walk), which has all the S/U Bahn lines so easy to get to from the airport. Lots of bars and restaurants nearby on Simon Dach Strabe.

Reviews.Title: “A real gem!”
Reviews.Author: Linzi76
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel tired and hungry but from the moment we entered the bright welcoming reception area to stepping into a lovely clean room we knew we had made a good choice. Staff were friendly and helpful, the evening buffet was inexpensive whilst allowing us to sample some German food without the risk of going hungry! The breakfast (bread rolls, jam, cereals, meats, cheeses, bacon, sausage, scrambled egg, salad, fruit etc etc) was filling and an excellent preparation for a day's sightseeing! The room was comfortable and airy, the roof garden terrace is a must although we didn't find it until our last night! Some fantastic views when clear. All in all an excellent value for money base to explore everything that Berlin has to offer. We are definitely returning next year!

Reviews.Title: “Very good and not so good”
Reviews.Author: martinnyc1
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Upstalsboom Hotel from May 25 to May 28, 2007. This was my sixth or seventh visit to Berlin and first stay at the Upstalsboom. The Good: The hotel is very clean. It is fairly new construction which is something I like in a hotel. It is located in a residential neighborhood, about 10 minutes from the nearest train and there are some convenient local food markets and restaurants. The staff is fantastic. They answered all my questions cheerfully, made dinner reservations for me, called taxis, gave directions and never hesitated to help out. I have stayed in luxury hotels where the level of service wasn't as good. The hotel has a beautiful roof garden where you can relax and have something to drink or just sit and read. The breakfast buffet was good and the dining room was pleasant. There is a computer for free high speed internet access. The not so good: My room was an attic room with a sloping roof. There was a large widow on the sloped roof and it was right over the bed. Since it was unseasonably warm and there is no ventilation in the hotel rooms I left the window open the first day and there was a severe rain/hail storm. The water poured in and onto my bed. The next day I closed the window when I left. Once again there was a severe storm. When I got back I found that the cleaning staff had left the window open and the water had once again poured onto the bed. Both times the front desk attendant came up to my room and very cheerfully changed the bedding and carried away the soaked blankets and pillows. I would suggest that if you are given one of these top floor rooms during the warmer months you might ask to be changed to another floor. Also, with no air conditioning the rooms in this hotel get very, very warm. I would probably choose a different hotel were I to return between May and September. Another negative about the room is that it had a door to the adjacent room. There was absolutely no sound proofing so the first night I had the very loud sound of the tv next door booming through my room until 1am. That guest checked out the next day and it was quiet from then on out. Bottom Line: I would stay in this hotel again if I could be sure not to be on the top floor and it was not summer weather.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jim-B0b
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 3 nights at this hotel and it was really great! We were able to check in at about 11am even though the usual check in is 3pm, so it was fantastic dumping our bags and getting out to explore. The hotel accommodation was brill, lovely massive and clean rooms; breakfast was tasty and had loads of options. Hotel is located on the eastern side of the city, and although not central as such, the transport links for the U-bahn and S-bahn are so convenient you don’t really notice. The nearest U and S-bahn is Warschauer strasse which is a 5 minute walk from the hotel. (Though I do recommend you print yourself a street map before you go, if you’re going to do like we did and go from airport to hotel by public transport) - Nothing like trapsing round with your case, trying to find your accommodation!! - Overall Upsatlsboom was a great base from which to explore Berlin, and really pleased we stayed somewhere like this rather than the sky skrapper style hotels located in the city. Jem, Kidderminster

Reviews.Title: “Hotel okay but not 4 star”
Reviews.Author: Haggis_on_tour
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel to visit the Christmas markets in Berlin. The Hotel website states it is 350 metres from the nearest railway station (Warschauer Str). I personally would say it is at least 500 metres, which was misleading for me as I travelled with a 2 year old. The hotel also states it has a shower/bath combination and if you are looking for a nice soak in a bath after seeing the sights, you will not get one as NONE of the rooms have baths they only have showers. The buffet breakfast is however excellent, with a wide variety of choice and runs from 0630 to 1030. The room was okay and comfortable, with the bathroom being very clean and well presented. let down by the quality of towels. Overall, value for money, not in a great part of the city (at night), and not in my opinion 4 star.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Base”
Reviews.Author: Garyn
Reviews.Content: Dont let the surrounding streets make you think you've made a mistake.Once you see the foyer you realise the quality .Fantastic service ,lovely room ,nice breakfast what more can I say. I would definatly recommend this Hotel as a base to visit the fascinating city of Berlin

Reviews.Title: “A great all rounder!!”
Reviews.Author: Corneilious101
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Upstalsboom for three nights with my girlfriend on our recent trip to Berlin. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay. The hotel is in an excellent location. To begin it only takes five minutes walk from the hotel to either the S-bahn and the U- bahn. The S-bahn can have you back at Schoenenfeld airport in 35mins and only takes 10mins max into the city centre. The area around the hotel has a lot to offer. Literally across the road is an excellent bar called ‘Hirsch’, which I recommend and a five minute walk away on Simon-Dach Strasse there is an uncountable amount of bars restaurants and take aways available. The bars around hear where also very good, especially Dachkammer Bar, that I did not need to go into central Berlin to find nightlife as it was already on the doorstep. There is also a flea market in Boxhagener Platz on a Sunday which if you stay in this area should not be missed. The stuff on sale is amazing. The hotel is clean and functional and the hotel staff are very friendly and speak excellent English which is good as my German is pretty poor. The breakfast provided by the hotel is excellent and should not be missed. On the weekend if you get down late it may be hard to get a table. So that must be a good sign. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “A Change at the Upstalsboom”
Reviews.Author: smjak02
Reviews.Content: Stayed here during World Cup, rate reflected that. Spotless room, large fan in place of Air Con. Excellent breakfast, secure parking. Very helpful staff. A lively area making an interesting contrast to the West where we had stayed the previous week. Would stay again although maybe not if in the car as it was a full half hour longer to get to than the west, obviously depending on where you were coming from and where you were going to if travelling around when you were there. Often the case with locations near a river too. Station referred to is Warschau Strasse, stations around here also S Bahn as well as underground, U Bahn.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: IanHinLondon
Reviews.Content: Located in a relatively quiet area in supposedly trendy east Berlin. It's about 5-10 mins walk from two diffenent U-/S-Bahn stations (Frankfurter Tor and Warsheinstrasse {?}). The hotel itself is fairly bland and business-like, but the rooms are spotless and large. The breakfast is exceptionally good. Overall, it's good, basically. Some good bars nearby, too.

Reviews.Title: “Superb value”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The "Upstalsboom Hotel Friedrichshain" provides superb value to a visitor to Berlin. Located near the metro station, it serves as a good starting point to reach Alexanderplatz, Zoogarten, KaDeWe, Brandenburg Gate, Sony Centre, etc.,.. The attached restaurant serves hearty breakfasts. There are trendy bars, pubs, and bistros nearby that are away from the usual tourist spots. The rooms are spacious and bathrooms are spotless.

HotelInfo.Name: Upstalsboom Hotel Friedrichshain
HotelInfo.Address: Gubener Strasse 42, 10243 Berlin, Germany
